parameters: \n<Elovia>Been getting a lot more use out of this old thing since Yurasa moved in...
\n<Elovia>Been getting a lot more use out of this old thing since Yurasa moved in...
\n<Elovia>Been getting a lot more use out of this old thing since Yurasa moved in...
\n<T2>Ah, good morning, Miss Atwin! You look better now you're awake.
\n<T2>No, wait. My filter was on. You still look terrible.
\n<T2>Oh, wait. Sorry, there's still water in my circuits after you last spilled some all over me. I meant "lackadaisical".
\n<Elovia>You always know what to say, T2.
\n<T2>How's our favourite social butterfly holding up?
\n<Elovia>You're linked to Yurasa.\.\. Can you tell me what he likes to do when he's out?
\n<Elovia>I know it's hard for you, but stop being an asshole and answer the question.
\n<T2>Okay, okay.\.\. He likes to go to the movies. Happy?
The presence of this fat ladybird fills you with a sense of peace.
The presence of this fat ladybird fills you with a sense of peace.
All sorts of comics and merch line the shelves.
\n<Elovia>I gotta repair this at some point...
\n<Elovia>So.\.\. What have you got for me this time?
\n<Yurasa>Actually, I was thinking you could choose what to do today.
\n<T2>Ooh, Miss Atwin's thinking about something, it seems?\.\. Rare occasion.
\n<Elovia>\fiI'm worried what I wanna do is gonna be uninteresting to him...\.\. I should take a look around to make sure what I suggest is something he likes.\fi
Interact with some of the objects around the room to find information. Talk to Yurasa again when you've collected enough information and wish to proceed.
\n<Elovia>Do you want to go and watch a movie together?
\n<Yurasa>You wouldn't by any chance know which movie theatre's nearest in this area, then?
\n<Elovia>Though, we do have to walk through the Great Forest for a bit to reach it.
\n<Yurasa>Oh, that place.\.\. You go on walks there all the time, dont'ya?
\n<Yurasa>T-2, we're going out.\. Don't touch any of my stuff.
\n<Yurasa>Especially not my movie about the robot mobsters.\.\. Or the one about the robot lobsters.\.\. Or the one about the mobster lob-\. just don't touch anything, okay?
\n<Elovia>These pancakes are\fi amazing\fi. Where'd you learn to cook?
\n<Yurasa>Oh,\. my parents were really busy.\.\. So I kinda had to learn how to cook by myself at home.
\n<Yurasa>For every edible pancake I make now, there were ten burnt, messy or just nasty ones from when I was younger.
\n<Yurasa>So,\. help yourself.\.\. I didn't spend all that trial and error-ing just so I could feed me and me alone.
\n<T2>Am I the only one who's getting a bit concerned?
\n<T2>This feels like a slow motion car crash.
This painting seems to touch the very soul.
Mountains and mountains of bug plushies threaten to spill out of the wardrobe.\.\.
Underneath them are some clothes, squashed into tight piles.
\nYou seem to have a fascination with that wardrobe, Miss Atwin.\.\.
Are you confused by the way it works, perhaps? Shall we add that to the list
\n<T2>Whatever you say, big man. Just remember that since I am an extension of
your powers, my personality is \fireally\fi an extension of yours- \. \^
Despite everything,\. it's still a wardrobe.
Underneath the bed lies boxes and boxes of movies.
A large amount of them seem to be sci-fi, but with how big the collection is,
"Tales of Heroism, featuring Freya and Elijah!"\.\.
Exclusive chance to see the dynamic duo in person!
\n<Elovia>\fiI've always thought those sorts of Gifted were rather show-offy, but Yurasa seems to really look up to them.\fi
There's a box of movies underneath the bed.
\n<Elovia>Yurasa seems to really like science fiction.
\n<Elovia>Some of these look really worn...\.\. and given how much he seems to love them, I don't think it's because of carelessness.
This painting seems to touch the very soul.
\n<Yurasa>Least I could do, considering you're the one letting me stay here.
\n<Elovia>Ah, it's nothing.\. I was letting a lot of this space go to waste, really.
\n<Yurasa>And hey,\. whenever you feel ready,\. I wanna talk to you about our plans, if that's alright?
Use the arrow keys to navigate the map and UI, and press [ESC] to open up the main menu.
\n<Elovia>So.\.\. What have you got for me this time?
\n<Yurasa>Actually, I was thinking you could choose what to do today.
\n<Elovia>(I don't \fiknow\fi things!\.\. Unless it's about bugs.)
\n<T2>Ooh, Miss Atwin's thinking about something, it seems?\.\. Rare occasion.
\n<Elovia>...Could you just give me a second, Yurasa?
Would you like to advance the storyline?
\n<Elovia>Would you like to, I dunno... come on a walk with me.\.\. Or something?
\n<Elovia>\fi(You've got such a way with words, Miss Atwin.)\fi
\n<Yurasa>Yes, of course! Anywhere in particular you'd like us to go?\! Preferably... nowhere with moths.
\n<Elovia>Nah, we're going beetle-watching.\. Ariel's Beetles, to be precise.\! They always settle around the same spot this time of year,\. it's beautiful.
\n<Yurasa>Alright, I'm down.\! And hey...\. when we come back, you wanna watch a movie again?
\n<Yurasa>S'all good. I think I've got a movie about mobster lobsters lying around here too, actually.
\n<Yurasa>For now though, let's go see us some beetles.
\n<Yurasa>T-2, we're going out.\. Don't touch any of my stuff.
\n<Elovia>You wanna, like... go out and look at bugs or something?
\n<Yurasa>Sure.\.\. Just checking, by 'bugs' you don't mean moths, right?
\n<T2>Yes, those famous 11:00 am moths. Very common.
\n<Elovia>Oh, no.\.\. No moths.\.\. There's some really cool beetles I\.\.\. reckon\.\. you'd\.\. like\. though.
\n<Elovia>If we head out now, the weather there should be ideal when we arrive.
\n<Yurasa>T-2, we're going out.\. Don't touch any of my stuff.
\n<Yurasa>Especially not my movie about the robot mobsters.\.\. Or the one about the robot lobsters.\.\. Or the one about the mobster lob- just don't touch anything, okay?
There's no rule or reason to how the objects in the fridge are ordered.
\n<Elovia>Yurasa seems to have lots of particular franchises he takes special interest in.
\n<Elovia>They made at least 8 movies about that?
